name: Curd Rice (Thayir Sadam)
history: Curd Rice, also known as Thayir Sadam in Tamil, is a staple in South Indian cuisine. It is a comfort food made with rice and yogurt, often eaten at the end of a meal to aid digestion and cool the palate.
description: Curd Rice is a simple and soothing dish made from cooked rice mixed with creamy yogurt and tempered with spices. It's known for its cooling properties and is often garnished with coriander, pomegranate, or grated cucumber.

instructions.title: Mix Rice with Yogurt
instructions.description: Mash the cooked rice slightly. While the rice is still warm, mix in the yogurt and milk to achieve a creamy consistency. Add salt to taste.

instructions.title: Temper the Spices
instructions.description: Heat ghee or oil in a frying pan. Add mustard seeds, urad dal, asafoetida, green chilies, curry leaves, and ginger. Fry until the mustard seeds splutter and the dal turns golden.

instructions.title: Combine Tempered Spices with Rice
instructions.description: Pour the tempered spices over the rice and yogurt mixture. Add chopped coriander leaves and mix well.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with pomegranate seeds and grated cucumber, if desired. Serve the Curd Rice chilled or at room temperature.

tips: Adjust the amount of milk and yogurt to get the desired consistency.
Serve chilled for a refreshing taste, especially in warm weather.
variations: Add fried cashews or raisins for a sweet and nutty flavor.
Experiment with different herbs and spices for variation.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Not typically reheated, as it is served chilled or at room temperature.
presentationTips: Serve in a bowl with a spoonful of pickle or a side salad.
Garnish with fresh herbs or edible flowers for an elegant presentation.
